intro: Mariscus dietrichiae var. brevibracteatus, commonly known as the short-bract mariscus, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct, serrated edge. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
